metadata.title: CVE-2017-17505 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference in the functionH5O_pline_decode in the H5Opline.c file in libhdf5.a. For example, h5dumpwould crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-4
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-4').
